messages.title: 1p tax to save the NHS
messages.content: Would you pay an extra penny to save the NHS? The NHS is at breaking point. With an ageing population, increasing costs, and cuts from the Tories, our NHS cannot be funded on wishful thinking and rhetoric. It is time for all parties to be honest with the British people about the huge investment required to protect the Health Service for future generations.

messages.title: We must fight a damaging Hard Tory Brexit
messages.content: 51.3% of Horsham residents voted remain and deserve a say on what happens next. Whether you leave or remain, the Tory Government is looking to push through a Hard Brexit. This involves no agreement with the EU and no guarantee of leaving the Single Market.

messages.title: Protecting Commuters
messages.content: Back in 2015 delays on Southern in particular more than doubled between 2010 and 2015, despite promises it wouldn’t get worse once changes were made... It’s astonishing that taxpayers’ money is set to be used to bail out a firm which lavishes its bosses with million pound wage packets.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Propose an additional £8.4 billion funding for NHS through a new 1p tax.
Plan to address overcrowded classes and provide better support for children’s education.
Campaign to stop a damaging Hard Tory Brexit and protect the Single Market.
Fight for contracts to be removed from GOVIA to ensure a reliable network for commuters.

issues.brexitEurope: Tory Government is looking to push through a Hard Brexit.
issues.education: With growing class sizes, more school staff are required. The Lib Dems' £7 billion pledge includes protection for school budgets.

community.content: Local Horsham school has been forced to cut a vital £250,000 support staff as internal cuts start to bite.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have spent many hundreds of hours meeting the people of Horsham and trying to help them solve problems.

quotes.text: I think being part of a 500m trading bloc is significant for us. I think one of the issues is a lot of people invest here in the UK because it's like the UK in Europe.
